title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 5119.2 - Video lottery terminal drop boxes
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 5119.2 - Video lottery terminal drop boxes

State Regulations
(a) The video lottery terminal drop boxes shall be secured by a lock on the main
door to the video lottery terminal, a lock on the currency compartment door, and a lock on the drop box, located in the currency compartment. Each lock
shall be keyed differently from the other. The keys to the main door lock shall
be maintained and controlled by a video lottery gaming agent employee. The key
to the lock securing the currency compartment area, which key shall be
different from the keys securing the contents of the drop box, shall be
maintained and controlled by the video lottery gaming agent security
department. Access to the key for the lock to the currency compartment area
shall be gained only by a supervisor in that department. (b) Each drop box shall have an affixed or
adhered clear visible label containing letters, numbers or a barcode
corresponding to the location of the video lottery terminal to which it is
attached, except that emergency drop boxes may be maintained without such
marking, provided the word "emergency" is affixed or adhered thereon and, when
put into use, are temporarily marked with the location of the video lottery
terminal. Notes

5119.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
